alert.note: Alert for Oregon; Ozark (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 04 at 7:28AM CST until further notice by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM CST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of east central, south central, and southwest Missouri, including the following counties, in east central Missouri, Phelps. In south central Missouri, Dent, Howell, Oregon and Texas. In southwest Missouri, Douglas, Laclede, Ozark, Webster and Wright. * WHEN...Until 1000 AM CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 726 AM CST, The Department of Transportation reported that several low water crossing remain flooded from runoff due to previous heavy rain in the advisory area that occurred Thursday evening Friday morning. - This includes the following low water crossings... Beaver Creek at Crewes Ford Road, Beaver Creek at County Road 524, Little North Fork River at County Road 916, Howell Creek at County Road 9790, Pond Fork at County Road 883, Bryant Creek at County Road 223 and Lick Creek at County Road 528. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... West Plains, Mountain Grove, Ava, Mountain View, Willow Springs, Houston, Licking, Cabool, Mansfield, Gainesville, Norwood, Hartville, Summersville, Raymondville, Bakersfield, Morgan, Dawson, Pomona, Theodosia, South Fork, Pontiac, Brandsville, Huggins, Wasola, Plato, Twin Bridges, Sundown, Vanzant, Drury, Gentryville, Dora, Elk Creek, Siloam Springs, Bendavis, Simmons, Brushyknob, Graff, Rockbridge, Solo and Sycamore. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles.
